decks.notes: The deck focuses on utilizing Karlov of the Ghost Council's ability to gain life and remove opponent's threats efficiently. It runs a mix of cheap removal spells, hand disruption, and protection spells to control the battlefield and keep Karlov safe. The deck has a strong aggro plan by deploying efficient creatures like Vampire Cutthroat and Soul Warden, while also providing ways to pump Karlov through equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Sword of Fire and Ice. The mana base is optimized to support the deck's aggressive strategy with a mix of Plains, Swamps, and dual lands to ensure consistent color access. Overall, the deck aims to gain life, control the board, and beat down opponents with Karlov and other creatures.

The deck focuses on utilizing a wide variety of mana dorks and utility creatures to ramp up quickly and apply pressure to the opponent. It includes cards like Noble Hierarch, Stoneforge Mystic, and Vizier of Remedies to generate mana and provide additional resources. The deck also features powerful removal such as Swords to Plowshares and Abrupt Decay to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. It aims to establish a strong board presence early on, while also having access to card draw and tutoring effects like Thrasios, Triton Hero and Birthing Pod to maintain its momentum and find key pieces to close out the game efficiently.

The main focus of this deck is to control and disrupt the opponent's game plan through a variety of counterspells, bounce spells, and card draw. Kefnet the Mindful serves as the commander, providing card advantage and a win condition. The deck includes a high number of counterspells like Counterspell, Force of Will, and Spell Pierce to prevent the opponent from resolving key spells. It also features bounce spells like Chain of Vapor and Engulf the Shore to deal with threats on the board. Card advantage is gained through spells like Fact or Fiction, Concentrate, and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. Overall, the deck aims to out-tempo and outvalue the opponent while controlling the game.

The deck revolves around playing a control-style game with the ability to bounce, counter, and manipulate opponent's spells and board state. The deck is focused on disruption and tempo plays, using cards like Cryptic Command, Counterspell, and Teferi, Temporal Archmage to control the board and stall the opponent's game plan. It also includes powerful card advantage engines like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Fact or Fiction to pull ahead in resources. The deck includes various utility creatures like Vendilion Clique and Snapcaster Mage to apply pressure and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's game plan and ensure consistency in casting spells.

This deck focuses on reanimation strategies, utilizing a variety of spells and creatures to bring powerful threats back from the graveyard. The key concept revolves around quickly filling up the graveyard with targeted self-discard effects and cards like Faithless Looting, then using reanimation spells like Reanimate, Animate Dead, and Living Death to cheat large creatures into play early in the game. Bruse Tarl, Boorish Herder provides a source of lifelink and additional combat tricks to keep the pressure on opponents while you set up your graveyard shenanigans. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with big threats like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite before they can fully establish their own game plan.

The deck focuses on using artifacts and spells to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. It includes cards that deal damage to creatures and players, mana acceleration, artifact removal, and mass land destruction. It aims to slow down the game with cards like Ensnaring Bridge and Tangle Wire, while also utilizing cards like Daretti, Scrap Savant to recur artifacts from the graveyard. The deck also includes powerful control tools like Nevinyrral's Disk and Mindslaver to dominate the board. Overall, the strategy is to control the game's tempo by controlling the opponent's resources and using Daretti's abilities to maintain card advantage and board presence.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through various disruption spells and removal cards, aiming to disrupt the opponent's strategy while maintaining control of the board. It includes a mix of hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, along with removal spells like Path to Exile and Terminate. The deck also includes board wipes like Damnation and Anger of the Gods to clear the battlefield when needed. In addition, it includes planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Nahiri, the Harbinger to provide additional value and card advantage. Overall, the deck aims to control the game and outvalue the opponent to secure a win.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive burn spells and creatures, focusing on dealing direct damage quickly and efficiently. The deck includes a wide range of burn spells like Lightning Bolt, Searing Blaze, and Fireblast, as well as aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Hell's Thunder. The goal is to maintain pressure on the opponent, constantly chipping away at their life total with burn spells and creatures, while also utilizing efficient removal spells to keep the board clear. With a high concentration of direct damage spells and aggressive creatures, this deck aims to finish the game quickly and decisively before the opponent can stabilize.
